original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at 307/308 to US dollar, bond yields steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka spot opened weaker at 307/308 to the US dollar on Friday, while bond yields were steady, dealers said.
The spot closed at 306.75/307.50 to the US dollar on Thursday after opening at 306.50/307.25 rupees.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 22.80/23.10 percent, steady from yesterday’s close at 22.85/23.05 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 was quoted at 27.o0/25 percent, steady from yesterday’s closing at 27.15/30 percent.
